xxl.cursors
Class Dropper

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.cursors.DecoratorCursor
        |
        +--xxl.cursors.Dropper
public class Dropper
extends DecoratorCursor

A Dropper drops a user-defined number of the given Iterator's elements.

The implementation is as follows: 


 	while (number>0 && iterator.hasNext());
 		iterator.next();

These elements are removed from the underlying collection, because next is called.

Example usage: 

	Dropper dropper = new Dropper(new Enumerator(11), 5);
		while(dropper.hasNext())
			System.out.println(dropper.next());
	dropper.close();
This example creates a new Dropper by using a new Enumerator with range 0,...,10 with the intention to drop the first five elements.
Therefore the generated output is: 5,6,7,8,9,10.

See Also:
Iterator, DecoratorCursor
